questions.question: What is the largest planet in our solar system?
Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
How many planets are in our solar system?
Which planet is closest to the Sun?
What is the name of Earth's natural satellite?

samples.topic: Countries and continents where animals live

questions.question: On which continent do wild kangaroos live?
Polar bears are native to which region?
In which country would you find wild giant pandas?
The Amazon rainforest, home to jaguars and macaws, spans across how many countries?
Which continent is the only natural habitat for penguins in the wild?
options: C) All continents with cold climates

questions.question: What is 7 + 5?
What is 15 - 8?
What is 6 ร 4?
What is 36 รท 6?
Which number is the largest?

samples.topic: Why do cats purr and what does it mean?

questions.question: What part of a cat's body produces the purring sound?
options: B) Their throat muscles and larynx

questions.question: Cats purr when they are happy, but what other emotion can cause purring?
At what frequency do cats typically purr?
Some scientists believe cat purring may help with what?
options: B) Bone healing and pain relief

questions.question: Do all cats, including big cats like lions, purr?
options: A) Yes, all cats purr the same way
B) No, big cats roar but       cannot purr continuously
C) Only domestic cats can purr

questions.question: Which company created Spider-Man and Iron Man?
Batman and Superman belong to which superhero universe?
Which team came first: The Justice League (DC) or The Avengers (Marvel)?
options: B) The Justice League by 3 years
C) They debuted the same year

questions.question: Which Marvel character was originally inspired by DC's Superman?
What is a major difference between how Marvel and DC typically portray their heroes?
options: A) DC heroes have no weaknesses
B) Marvel heroes tend to have more personal flaws and relatable problems
C) DC heroes never work in teams
D) Marvel heroes are always aliens

questions.question: Who developed the theory of general relativity?
Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize. In which field was her first Nobel?
Which scientist is credited with discovering the structure of DNA along with James Watson?
Charles Darwin is famous for his theory of evolution. What was the name of his famous book?
options: C) On the Origin of Species

questions.question: Nikola Tesla made major contributions to which field?
options: B) Electrical engineering and AC power

samples.topic: What makes a song become a hit?

questions.question: What musical element do most hit songs have in common?
options: B) A memorable, catchy hook or chorus

questions.question: What is the typical length of a hit pop song?
What role does streaming play in determining if a song is a 'hit' today?
options: A) Streaming has no impact on charts
B) Streams are counted toward chart positions like Billboard Hot 100

questions.question: The 'millennial whoop' is a melodic pattern found in many pop hits. What is it?
options: B) An alternating pattern between the fifth and third notes
D) A type of vocal distortion

questions.question: Why do many hit songs use the I-V-vi-IV chord progression?
options: A) It's required by music labels
B) It creates a familiar, emotionally satisfying sound
C) It's the only legal chord progression

samples.topic: How do economic recessions impact global trade patterns and employment rates across different sectors?

questions.question: During a recession, what typically happens to global trade volume?
options: A) It increases due to lower prices
B) It decreases as demand falls and credit tightens
D) Only luxury goods trade decreases

questions.question: Which employment sector is typically most affected during economic recessions?
What is 'protectionism' and how does it relate to recessions?
options: A) A policy to increase exports only
B) Trade barriers countries may impose to protect domestic industries during downturns
C) A type of unemployment insurance
D) A central bank monetary policy

questions.question: The 2008 financial crisis led to what phenomenon in global supply chains?
options: A) Rapid expansion of all supply chains
C) Disruption and a push toward supply chain diversification
D) Complete elimination of international trade

questions.question: What is a 'jobless recovery' in the context of recessions?
options: A) When only high-paying jobs return
B) When GDP grows but employment remains stagnant
C) When unemployment benefits run out
D) When only government jobs are created
